import urllib.parse

def solution(source_url):
    # Set default port
    scheme = 'http'
    if source_url.startswith('https'):
        scheme = 'https'
        default_port = 443
    else:
        default_port = 80

    # Parse URL
    parsed_url = urllib.parse.urlparse(source_url)

    # Extract parts
    host = parsed_url.hostname
    port = parsed_url.port or default_port
    path = parsed_url.path
    query = parsed_url.query

    # Return parts
    return [host, str(port), path]

We will first check the scheme of the URL and set the default port accordingly. Then, we will use the urlparse function to parse the URL and extract the host, port, path, and query. Finally, we will return these parts as a list in the required order.
